text: compact crossovers have advantages
they're easy to park surgical through
urban traffic and easy on fuel they also
swallow boxes that sedans simply can't
handle outies q3 which looks very much
like this q5 the only left in the dryer
a bit longer is a good-looking rig and
that's what outie does a front driver
begins at around 35 grand add Quattro
that's all wheel drive and how to speak
plus a few options to this small ute and
the sticker grows to nearly forty three
large spend that kind of money and it's
foolish not to cross shop the
competition in this case it's the BMW x1
Mercedes GLA and Lexus NX this 2016
model gets a light refresh the grille is
the biggest clue unlike the a3 sedan and
new Volkswagen Golf q3 does not ride on
the new MQB platform the 2-liter
four-cylinder is turbocharged with 200
horsepower
and 207 pound-feet of torque
it's paired with a snappy six-speed
gearbox with paddle shifters outtie
Drive select lets you tune stuff like
throttle response time your runs to 60
miles an hour much
it happens in just under 8 seconds with
q3 if you're running the quarter-mile
against the GLA or x1 you're going to
lose stats figures are deceptive though
in everyday driving this is a satisfying
vehicle part of it is the nimble size
but it's the refinement that really
shines it's fairly quiet at speed jeath
green suspension is not overly stiff and
the ride quality is comfortable still
it's fun to chuck in the corners there
are sporty sedans that are less fun to
drive fuel economy is lowest in class
with all-wheel drive I averaged about 21
miles per gallon it prefers premium fuel
I find q3 throttle response a little
sluggish
unless OD Drive select is in dynamic and
the transmission is in sport overall the
pilot will enjoy driving this compact
crossover they'll appreciate the cockpit
to outies reputation for elegant design
and quality materials is present and
accounted for sport seats hold firmly in
corners with generous bolsters it
boggles my brain that outtie still ships
cars without a USB port and this
proprietary cord with the connector that
Apple changed what three years ago
backup cameras are optional on some
premium brands its standard on q3 I'm
sure this girl appreciates that another
plus the MMI user interface is pretty
straightforward if you're hauling child
seats in and out of the q3 note that the
door opening is a little on the small
side I'm 5 foot 9 and I'm comfortable
back here wouldn't want it any smaller
though the normal storage cubbies are
found here and phones can be charged no
heated seats though there are belts for
three I suggest stopping at two q3s
forward leaning back pillar certainly is
stylish but it does eat into cargo space
there's not much help under here yes the
back seats split and fold and if you hit
the slopes often or need a couple two by
fours the outside positions stay usable
or maybe you need a lot of this stuff in
that case
you can just pack in half a dozen
bundles simply put the q3 delivers the
Audi crossover experience in fun sighs
if only were priced accordingly
Americans seem to be embracing the
concept that luxury vehicles don't have
to be the size of an aircraft carrier
and that the four rings command a
premium for singles and couples q3
offers a practical and polished driving
experience
